title: Motiva
subheading: Be inspired every day with new quotes.
about:
This was a project I was asked to do as part of an interview process. The criteria was to create a simple quote generator that displays quotes from an API with the following criterias:

  1. Display a random inspirational quote every minute.
  2. Enable users to save their favorite quotes to local storage for easy access later.
  3. Use Nuxt with Vue3 with the Composition API and Vuetify for UI components.

title: Image Mint
subheading: Mint your images into NFTs on the Polygon mainnet.
about:
This project utilizes OpenZeppelin's ERC721 contract template to create a Solidity smart contract with a small adition that limits users to mint up to 10,000 images as NFTs. Deployed on the Polygon mainnet, this platform offers an affordable and interactive experience for users.

The frontend is developed using Next.js and TypeScript, providing a user-friendly interface for interacting with the application. Users can easily connect their MetaMask wallets via the Ethereum window object and proceed to mint their images. Image uploading and pinning are handled securely through Pinata's API, ensuring that images are permanently stored on the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS).

After entering all necessary metadata, users can mint their NFTs directly through the smart contract and seamlessly store them on the blockchain. The application leverages Wagmi for efficient and reliable blockchain transactions.

This project not only offers a practical application of blockchain technology but also provides a platform for users to engage with digital asset creation and management.
future: I am planning to continue working on this project to include more more features. In these expansions I will focus on expanding my work with the blockchain and smart contracts.

title: Simply Finance
subheading: Get an understanding for your income allocation's effect on your future finances.
about: This project was inspired by my own need to better predict my future financial situation and after many attempts to teach my girlfriend how I think about money, I decided to pivot the project to be more educational. My approach is a visual and interactive type of app, where the user adjusts a colorful bar that represents your monthly income. Below are two graphs representing real time calculations of these two accounts future outlook. When the user adjusts the income allocation, a new graph is created which diverges from the old to show the consequences of the changes.
goal: The goal is to give a visual understanding for budgeting and teach the user how to financially plan for the future.
future: In the future it will be possible to add monetary goals, so a user can plan for bigger purchases such as a car. The idea is to show what such a purchase costs, not only in todays money, but what it will cost the user in the future, if the money is taken away from i.e. the investment account.
collaborations: The designs for this project were done by Caterina Pomari.

title: Personal Website
subheading: See how this page is build and hear my own thoughts behind it.
about:
This project represents my personal website, which you are currently browsing. From here you will always be able to see my latest achievements and personal projects.

The project consists of a simple React Single Page Application (SPA), built with Vite and hosted on Netlify. As a fun addition I have created a PDF version of my resume that dynamically updates to reflect the latest content from my resume page. When you download my resume, it is freshly generated using Puppeteer on a cloud server hosted at fly.io inside a secure Docker container. The server is secured with basic authentication to prevent unauthorized access and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) setup to allow secure web interactions. Feel free to explore the server code on my GitHub page: https://github.com/lindjacob/cvtopdf.
goal: My goal was to showcase my capabilities as a developer by employing those very skills to create a digital platform, thus allowing the code to speak for itself.
future: This is a project under continuous developement. As I keep playing and learning more, this site will continue to grow and display my latest professional advances.

title: Jamming
subheading: Build a new playlist and add it to your Spotify account.
about: This is one of my first React projects from 2019, which uses the old class components in React. The idea was to showcase some of my skills working with React and APIs in as simple a setup as possible. The app has no server side, so fetching an API-token from Spotify and using it in a seamless way, is done by saving the values in the browser's local storage.
goal: To showcase work with APIs and React.
